revised_title: Kleinian Characterization of Asymptotic Symmetries in Real General Relativity
tldr: The author explores the asymptotic symmetries of real general relativity using Klein's Erlanger program. They provide concrete models for the corresponding projective actions and geometric structures on the spaces of affine 3-planes, characterizing the asymptotic symmetry groups of general relativity. This approach offers a possible explanation for the observed discreteness of elementary particle spins.
